name: ayu-rs (dark theme)
description:
Gorgeous dark theme for various Rust websites. Please see the Github repo for details on setting up the Rust playground theme correctly and the preferred installation method (directly with Stylus). Sites supported:
  • docs.rs
  • crates.io
  • play.rust-lang.org
  • play.integer32.com
  • this-week-in-rust.org
additional_info:
Release 1.5.8
    * The style can now be installed directly with Stylus as a UserCSS; see the repo for details!
        * This is the preferred way to install the style

Release 1.5.7
    * Fixes in response to new "inner-main" class on crates.io
        * Fixes headers and lists

Release 1.5.6
    * More fixes for crates.io

Release 1.5.5
    * Major fixes for crates.io
    * Minor fixes for Docs.rs
    * Better URL matching for Rustbyexample

Release 1.5.4
    * A few more small fixes for issues I noticed while browsing around
    * Color derive and attribute macro names correctly in rustdoc
    * Support rustdoc's new code block line numbering feature

Release 1.5.3
    * Various fixes for issues reported on Github, thanks to the reporter!
    * Removes support for the Rust site and blog; the new site has a heavily opinionated style that would be hard to theme. I may re-add support for the blog at some point, though.

Release 1.5.2
    * Fixes rustdoc inline code background color, again (lol)
    * Also fixes rustdoc's source code viewer so the line numbers are correctly aligned (yay!)

Release 1.5.1:
    * Fixes rustdoc inline code background color
    * Plus a few other misc. fixes for new rustdoc changes / features

Release 1.5:
    * Added support for blog.rust-lang.org

Release 1.4.2:
    * Fixes method syntax highlighting being all-orange in rustdoc 1.26
    * Applies rustbyexample tweaks to its new home, doc.rust-lang.org

Release 1.4.1:
    * Fixes for the new playground look

Release 1.4:
    * Added support for This Week in Rust (finally!)
    * Small tweaks and fixes

Release 1.3.2:
    * Fixes for various small issues with rustdoc, docs.rs, crates.io, etc.
    * Notably, fixes the white navbar on docs.rs

Release 1.3.1:
    * Made rustdoc theme apply to Manishearth's `rustc_private` docs at https://manishearth.github.io/rust-internals-docs/ (thanks to rep-nop on github for the PR!)

Release 1.3.0:
    * Added support for rustbyexample (themes the Ace editor for use with the natively-included Ayu theme)
    * Added support for www.rust-lang.org
    * Fixed various issues with the crates.io CSS

Release 1.2.3:
    * Fixed crates.io search bar background
    * Fixed doc.crates.io code block text color

Release 1.2.2:
    * Fixed the sidebar item highlight color

Release 1.2.1:
    * Fixed up the styling for the book version rendered via mdBook

Release 1.2.0:
    * Support added for crates.io
    * Support added for doc.crates.io

Release 1.1.2:
    * Fixes for recent HTML changes in integer32's playground
    * Styling for integer32's playground help page

Release 1.1.1 (current):
    * Fixes new sidebar style, line number alignment, and a couple other things.

Release 1.1.0:
    * Support added for play.rust-lang.org and play.integer32.com
      - Make sure you select the `Chrome` theme in the editor in order to use this theme's editor look
    * Various fixes
      - Largest is the correction of the code white color, it is now easier on the eyes and true to the               original theme

Release 1.0.0:
    * Support for docs.rs, anything rustdoc and anything doc.rust-lang.org
